alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 22 at 2:32PM PST until January 23 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Increased threat of sneaker waves expected. * WHERE...Coastal Del Norte, Northern Humboldt Coast, Southwestern Humboldt and Mendocino Coast Counties. * WHEN...From late tonight through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Large, unexpected waves can sweep across the beach without warning, sweeping people into the sea from rocks, jetties, and beaches. These sneaker waves can also move large objects such as logs, crushing anyone caught underneath.
info.instruction: Don`t be fooled by an ocean that looks calm. There can be 30 minutes of small waves before a sneaker wave strikes. Avoid rocks and jetties. Avoid steep beaches. Stay much farther back from the water and never turn your back on the ocean.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt
